page.title: 02SUNKEN FOREST - ST OUEN
page.content:
Between the Watersplash Night club and the Milano Bars there is a peat area which was once a forest. The forest grew after the last glacial period finished some 10000 years ago. It flourished until well into Neolithic times when it was eventually buried beneath blown sand.
The sea level rose to its present level about 2,000 years B.C.and since then the sea has eroded the peat areas. In the future these may be eroded away from the beach but the forest will still exist in the area because it extends under the sand dunes. In the peat we have found worked flint and Neolithic pottery which shows that the area was inhabited all that time ago.
